br.uff.midiacom.ana.interfaces
Class NCLArea<T extends NCLElement>

java.lang.Object
  br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.xml.XMLElementPrototype<T>
      br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.ncl.NCLElementPrototype<T>
          br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.ncl.NCLIdentifiableElementPrototype<T>
              br.uff.midiacom.ana.interfaces.NCLArea<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
P -
I -
Ei -
All Implemented Interfaces:
NCLInterface<T>, NCLElement<T>, ReferredElement<T>, XMLElement<T>
public class NCLArea<T extends NCLElement>
extends NCLIdentifiableElementPrototype<T>
implements NCLInterface<T>

Class that represents an area element. An area represents a media node anchor. A media node anchor represents a subpart of that node content.
This element defines the attributes:

  • id - id of the area element. This attribute is required.
  • coords - coordinates of the spatial anchor. This attribute is optional.
  • begin - start of the temporal anchor. This attribute is optional.
  • end - end of the temporal anchor. This attribute is optional.
  • text - characters that represents the textual anchor. This attribute is optional.
  • position - occurrence of the characters that represents the textual anchor. This attribute is optional.
  • first - initial sample of the anchor. This attribute is optional.
  • last - final sample of the anchor. This attribute is optional.
  • label - characters used to identify a content of the media. This attribute is optional.

setCoords

public void setCoords(ArrayType coords)
               throws XMLException
Sets the coordinates that defines a spatial anchor. This attribute is optional. Set the coors to null to erase a coordinate already defined.
A spatial anchor defines a portion of the media object (in space). This attribute can be used together with the begin and end attribute to define a spatio-temporal anchor.

Parameters:
coords - element representing the coordinates of the anchor or null to erase a coordinate already defined.
Throws:
XMLException

getCoords

public ArrayType getCoords()
Returns the coordinates that defines a spatial anchor or null if the attribute is not defined.
A spatial anchor defines a portion of the media object (in space). This attribute can be used together with the begin and end attribute to define a spatio-temporal anchor.

Returns:
element representing the coordinates of the anchor or null if the attribute is not defined.

setBegin

public void setBegin(TimeType begin)
              throws XMLException
Sets the start time of a temporal anchor. This attribute is optional. Set the begin to null to erase a start time already defined.
A temporal anchor defines a portion of the media object (time interval). The ending time of a temporal anchor is defined by the attribute end. If the attribute begin is defined but the attribute end is not, than the temporal anchor end time will be considered the end of the media object, that is, its duration.

Parameters:
begin - element representing the start time of the anchor or null to erase a begin already defined.
Throws:
XMLException
See Also:

This attribute can be used together with the coords attribute to define a spatio-temporal anchor.
In case the media element parent of the anchor has the type application/x-ginga-time, the start time must be defined as a absolute time of the Universal Time Coordinated (UTC). In this case, the begin attribute must be defined with the following syntax: Year:Month:Day:Hour:Minute:Second:Fraction.
Otherwise, the begin attribute must be defined with the following syntax: Hour:Minute:Second:Fraction or Seconds

getBegin

public TimeType getBegin()
Returns the start time of a temporal anchor or null if the attribute is not defined.
A temporal anchor defines a portion of the media object (time interval). The ending time of a temporal anchor is defined by the attribute end. If the attribute begin is defined but the attribute end is not, than the temporal anchor end time will be considered the end of the media object, that is, its duration.

Returns:
element representing the start time of the anchor or null if the attribute is not defined.
See Also:

This attribute can be used together with the coords attribute to define a spatio-temporal anchor.
In case the media element parent of the anchor has the type application/x-ginga-time, the start time must be defined as a absolute time of the Universal Time Coordinated (UTC). In this case, the begin attribute must be defined with the following syntax: Year:Month:Day:Hour:Minute:Second:Fraction.
Otherwise, the begin attribute must be defined with the following syntax: Hour:Minute:Second:Fraction or Seconds

setEnd

public void setEnd(TimeType end)
            throws XMLException
Sets the ending time of a temporal anchor. This attribute is optional. Set the end to null to erase a ending time already defined.
A temporal anchor defines a portion of the media object (time interval). The start time of a temporal anchor is defined by the attribute begin. If the attribute end is defined but the attribute begin is not, than the temporal anchor start time will be considered the start of the media object.

Parameters:
end - element representing the ending time of the anchor or null to erase a end already defined.
Throws:
XMLException
See Also:

This attribute can be used together with the coords attribute to define a spatio-temporal anchor.
In case the media element parent of the anchor has the type application/x-ginga-time, the ending time must be defined as a absolute time of the Universal Time Coordinated (UTC). In this case, the end attribute must be defined with the following syntax: Year:Month:Day:Hour:Minute:Second:Fraction.
Otherwise, the end attribute must be defined with the following syntax: Hour:Minute:Second:Fraction or Seconds

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String text)
             throws XMLException
Sets the characters that represents the textual anchor. This attribute is optional. Set the text to null to erase a text already defined.
Since the same characters can appear more than once in the media object text, the position attribute indicates which instance is considered by the anchor.

Parameters:
text - string representing the characters that defined the textual anchor or null to erase a text already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if the string is empty.
See Also:
setPosition(java.lang.Integer)

Returns:
string representing the characters that defined the textual anchor or null if the attribute is not defined.

setPosition

public void setPosition(java.lang.Integer position)
                 throws XMLException
Sets the occurrence of the characters that represents the textual anchor. This attribute is optional. Set the text to null to erase a position already defined.
Since the same characters can appear more than once in the media object text, this attribute indicates which instance is considered by the anchor.

Parameters:
position - positive integer that represents the character position in the text or null to erase a position already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if the integer is negative.
See Also:

setFirst

public void setFirst(SampleType first)
              throws XMLException
Sets the initial sample of a content anchor. This attribute is optional. Set the first to null to erase a initial sample already defined.
A content anchor defines a portion of the media object (sample interval). The final sample of a content anchor is defined by the attribute last. If the attribute first is defined but the attribute last is not, than the content anchor final sample will be considered the last sample of the media object.

Parameters:
first - element representing the initial sample of the anchor or null to erase a initial sample already defined.
Throws:
XMLException
See Also:

The first attribute must be defined with the following syntax: Samples, Frames or Normal Play Time. See the reference (ABNT NBR 15606-2) to more information.

getFirst

public SampleType getFirst()
Returns the initial sample of a temporal anchor or null if the attribute is not defined.
A content anchor defines a portion of the media object (sample interval). The final sample of a content anchor is defined by the attribute last. If the attribute first is defined but the attribute last is not, than the content anchor final sample will be considered the last sample of the media object.

Returns:
element representing the initial sample of the anchor or null if the attribute is not defined.
See Also:

The first attribute must be defined with the following syntax: Samples, Frames or Normal Play Time. See the reference (ABNT NBR 15606-2) to more information.

setLast

public void setLast(SampleType last)
             throws XMLException
Sets the final sample of a content anchor. This attribute is optional. Set the last to null to erase a final sample already defined.
A content anchor defines a portion of the media object (sample interval). The initial sample of a content anchor is defined by the attribute first. If the attribute last is defined but the attribute first is not, than the content anchor initial sample will be considered the first sample of the media object.

Parameters:
last - element representing the final sample of the anchor or null to erase a final sample already defined.
Throws:
XMLException
See Also:

The last attribute must be defined with the following syntax: Samples, Frames or Normal Play Time. See the reference (ABNT NBR 15606-2) to more information.

Returns:
